p: For example, rosmarinic acid has been approved as a natural antioxidant since it has antimicrobial, antiviral, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory activities, making it a valuable component for the pharmaceutical, food, and cosmetic industries [ 104, 105]. Other naturally active antioxidant agents, such as linalool [ 106], nisin [ 107], cinnamaldehyde [ 108], curcumin [ 109], red beet [ 110], ascorbic acid [ 111], tea polyphenols [ 112], ferulic acid [ 113], and quercetin [ 113], have been used as functional additives due to their antioxidant properties, including free radicals scavenging.
